definition: to open one's mouth/to start to talk

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
a dike breaks/fig. to provide facilities (for evil deeds)/to open the floodgates
(Internet slang) to use foul language (pun on 出口成章[chu1 kou3 cheng2 zhang1])

sentences.english: You should sing according to my drumbeats, otherwise, there would be no order.
sentences.chinese: 打的鼓點開口，否則就沒有板眼了。

sentences.english: So long as opens the mouth to sing, lengthens until the dream, hears the echo to be resonant.
sentences.chinese: 只要開口唱，直到夢想延長，聽到迴音多嘹亮。

sentences.english: Niki's voice provoked a new bout of unreasoning anger.
sentences.chinese: 妮基一開口又激起了無名的怒火。

sentences.english: They're perfect for closing open plastic bags, such as rice bags.
sentences.chinese: 它們也是修復塑料袋開口的完美選擇，比如米袋。

sentences.english: KOTORI :Although he don't speak much with his mouth, he always speaks with his heart.
sentences.chinese: 雖然他不太開口說話，可是他總是用心在說呢。

sentences.english: The cardboard box is provided with a plurality of hatches and a rift. The rift is connected with the hatch.
sentences.chinese: 紙箱具有多個開口和一隙縫，該隙縫連接開口。

sentences.english: The cardboard box is provided with a plurality of hatches and a rift. The rift is connected with the hatch.
sentences.chinese: 紙箱具有多個開口和一隙縫，該隙縫連接開口。

sentences.english: The wind tower is a system for capturing air currents with openings at the top facing the prevailing winds.
sentences.chinese: 風塔是一種頂部開口，面向主風，捕捉氣流的系統。

sentences.english: Tang Li wants to get Tang Zheng just dont know how to speak.
sentences.chinese: 唐力想把唐正找來只是還不知道怎麼開口。

sentences.english: The cylindrical shells and open shells with discontinuity and dissymmetry in thickness are considered as laminated shells.
sentences.chinese: 視壁厚不連續不對稱的圓柱殼或開口殼爲層合殼。

sentences.english: And still. Harry hadn"t asked Cho to the ball."
sentences.chinese: 哈利仍舊沒有開口邀請秋去舞會。

sentences.english: But our boss started to talk, curassow also has upgrade of toughen one's scalp-brace oneself to rush only.
sentences.chinese: 但是俺們老闆都開口了，大鳥也只有硬着頭皮往上衝。

sentences.english: She waited for Narcissus to speak first, and prepared her answer.
sentences.chinese: 她等待着那西塞斯先開口，並準備着她的回答。

sentences.english: Because I have dared to open my mouth to sing at all.
sentences.chinese: 還是因爲我敢開口唱所以心情長。

sentences.english: The openings to the upper heart chambers are visible.
sentences.chinese: 其上部心室外的開口處可明見。

sentences.english: Open your mouth and ask if you think something is bothering your spouse.
sentences.chinese: 如果你覺得你的愛人有什麼煩心事，那就開口問問他。

definition: to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to refuse/to decline/to reject
to bow the head/to yield/to give in
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
tone of voice/the way one speaks/manner of expression/tone
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to speak out/to declare (one's view)
at this time/at this moment
to nod
to discuss/reason (behind sth)
to state/to say (the quoted words)
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to retort/to refute
now/this moment
always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
to hesitate
